clinical_study.brief_title: Internet and Social Media Use in Dermatology Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Internet and Social Media Use in Dermatology Patients - a Survey

brief_summary.textblock: This study is to assess Internet and social media use in dermatology patients

detailed_description.textblock: The Internet and social media bear potential in terms of heath care consumer education, prevention of diseases and dissemination of evidence-based information. The use of the internet and social media platforms both by dermatologists and patients is rapidly evolving. In order to improve the presence and visibility of dermatology-related evidence-based informations on the Internet and in social media, the use and behavior of dermatology patients in this context is studied in more detail.

primary_outcome.measure: Use of the Internet as a source of medical information
primary_outcome.time_frame: single time point assessment at baseline
primary_outcome.description: self-administered patient questionnaire regarding motivation to seek for medical information on the Internet

primary_outcome.measure: Use of Social media as a source of medical information
primary_outcome.time_frame: single time point assessment at baseline
primary_outcome.description: self-administered patient questionnaire regarding motivation to seek for medical information in Social media

primary_outcome.measure: Duration of Internet/ Social media use by dermatology patients
primary_outcome.time_frame: single time point assessment at baseline
primary_outcome.description: self-administered patient questionnaire covering duration of Internet/ Social media use (up to 2 hours/ day; 2 to 4 hours/day; more than 4 hours/day)

primary_outcome.measure: Quality assessment (by patients) of medical information provided
primary_outcome.time_frame: single time point assessment at baseline
primary_outcome.description: self-administered patient questionnaire covering quality of medical information provided on the Internet (5 point self-rating scale from very bad to very good)

primary_outcome.measure: Impact of internet/social media on the patient-physician relationship
primary_outcome.time_frame: single time point assessment at baseline
primary_outcome.description: self-administered patient questionnaire covering impact of internet/social media on the patient-physician relationship (self-rating scale: positive/ negative/ no impact)

primary_outcome.measure: Previous use of online medical services and online shopping of drugs/medications
primary_outcome.time_frame: single time point assessment at baseline
primary_outcome.description: self-administered patient questionnaire assessing previous use of online medical services and online shopping of drugs/medications (yes/ no)

intervention.description: self-administered patient questionnaire regarding the different aspects of internet and social media use in dermatology patients

study_pop.textblock: Outpatients treated at the Department of Dermatology of University Hospital Basel

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients treated at the Department of Dermatology of University Hospital Basel
Exclusion Criteria:
- Insufficient knowledge of German language
